P G Suresh Sir, please consider doing a discussion on the following:
1. St Stephens Delhi (estd 1881) - 50% reservation for CHRISTIANS.
2. St Xaviers Mumbai (estd 1869) - 42.5% reservation for CHRISTIANS.
3. CMC Vellore(estd 1900) - 74% reservation for CHRISTIANS.
4. Loyola College Chennai (estd 1925) - 40% reservation for CHRISTIANS.

In 1700, when "CHRISTIAN" Britishers stepped onto our country's soil, our country's(Bharat's) GDP was 24.5% of World GDP.

In 1947, when "CHRISTIAN" Britishers left our country, our country's(Bharat's) GDP came down to 1.5% of World GDP.

With our own "LOOTED WEALTH", if CHRISTIAN Britishers established St Stephens, St Xaviers, CMC, Loyola in our soil between 1700 and 1947, why should ONLY the present generation converted christians(consisting of just 3% of India's population) exclusively enjoy 40%, 42.5%, 50% and 74% in the year 2023 also?

Broadminded Achayans should constantly fight and NATIONALIZE these type of thousands of institutions across India so that the remaining 97% unconverted indians( hindus, muslims,jains, sikhs, buddhists, parsis etc..) also get EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES.
For 75 years, 3% christians(achayans) took unfair competitive advantage over other communities. Now, atleast they should stop being "greedy" and share equal opportunities with the remaining 97% Indian population also.
